No supermoon, it is raining ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
I have super moon pics! The computer they are in isn't detecting a boot drive too!!!
All was not lost! I woke up at 6:45, and the skies were clear, and I saw it! No pictures though.

My father knows someone who owns a mini observatory and takes these photos:

![24174664_10214712728074570_8020424888415](https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/24174664_10214712728074570_8020424888415268664_n.jpg?oh=fa1bc411f15cc502035b3366fd6567c3&oe=5AC96439)

![23795939_10214619862472988_7192880337404](https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/23795939_10214619862472988_7192880337404313710_n.jpg?oh=bed7e65842dc7fe956ba81f2c61cce01&oe=5AD592B5)

![23754849_10214619870993201_2052051192821](https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/23754849_10214619870993201_2052051192821079558_n.jpg?oh=bd995cfdb4721f668efa43f90b1d6fe2&oe=5ACA9BB9)

![22528133_10214327948015309_8807830189415](https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/22528133_10214327948015309_8807830189415786224_n.jpg?oh=8e3559c8307c73722427a43289ba23d3&oe=5ACBFD0D)

Awesome, right?? I am pleased to know him. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

If you want to see more, here is his Youtube channel: 

[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKy1byNPZrXLwd82TB6RPqQ/videos](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKy1byNPZrXLwd82TB6RPqQ/videos)

I *definitely* prefer android! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
I just enjoyed the Geminid meteor shower last night. For the last 15-30mins from ~12:00 to 12:30, I saw, on average, 1 meteor per minute, sometimes 2'

The clouds are moving quickly and have some holes in them...crossing my fingers that it becomes decent in the next two hours for hunting for Phaethon and spotting a few Geminids. I'm mostly confident I could see it if it was clear between Cassiopeia and Auriga.

Edit: Gaps between clouds are increasing, and I had a clear line of sight to Perseus for a minute or so...I think there's a pretty good chance they'll become sparse enough for a proper observation of the asteroid's movement soon.

Edit 2: IT'S CLEAR! Better get the hell to it; it's asteroid time!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-14T00:53:28Z" title="12/14/2017 12:53  AM" data-short="6 yr">December 14, 2017</time> by cubinator**

I think I'll be able to find it, but I just came in to warm up and my fingers really hurt for a few minutes. I guess an hour, in 21°F, is as long as I should go. I'll go back out soon for more squinting.

I saw two beautiful bright meteors sailing through the sky though!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-14T01:47:32Z" title="12/14/2017 01:47  AM" data-short="6 yr">December 14, 2017</time> by cubinator**

I saw it!

That was really hard. My eyes and knees are tired. It was close to the zenith so I had to kneel for the better part of two hours to look in the vicinity, and I basically didn't even have a chance of seeing it if I looked at anything else for about five or ten minutes. I finally spotted an unmistakable object in the right place and stared "at" it (slightly away to avoid the blind spot) for a couple of minutes and then came in to check on Stellarium whether I looked at the correct object. Turns out I did, so I've now seen an asteroid the size of a mountain from 12.9 Gm away!
[![42776eab2d9d5019776b5a48619eaa0b.png](http://hostthenpost.org/uploads/42776eab2d9d5019776b5a48619eaa0b.png)](http://hostthenpost.org)
